title: Backend Drugstore Microservices
shortDescription: Scalable microservices architecture for pharmaceutical management
fullDescription: A complete microservices architecture for a drugstore application with inventory management, prescription processing, and customer management systems. Built with event-driven architecture and containerized deployment.

problemStatement.problemDescription: Traditional drugstore systems struggle with real-time inventory tracking, prescription processing delays, and lack of scalability during peak hours.
problemList: Manual inventory tracking leading to stock discrepancies
Slow prescription processing causing customer wait times
Inability to scale during seasonal demand spikes
Fragmented data across multiple standalone systems

solution.title: Event-Driven Microservices Architecture
solution.description: Implemented a decoupled microservices system with real-time event processing and container orchestration.
keyFeatures: Real-time inventory updates via event sourcing
Automated prescription validation workflow
Scalable containerized deployment on Kubernetes
CQRS pattern for optimized read/write operations
solution.architecture: Event-driven microservices with message queue (RabbitMQ) for inter-service communication

title: Reading Tracker API
shortDescription: RESTful API for personal reading management
fullDescription: A Go-based RESTful API for tracking reading progress across books, articles, and papers. Features include progress tracking, categorization, tagging, and reading statistics with JWT authentication.

problemStatement.problemDescription: Readers lack a centralized system to track progress across multiple books and articles, leading to abandoned reads and poor reading habits.
problemList: No unified system to track multiple reading sources
Difficulty measuring reading progress and consistency
Inability to categorize and tag reading materials
Lack of insights into reading patterns and statistics

solution.title: RESTful API with Progress Analytics
solution.description: Built a lightweight Go API with MongoDB for flexible document storage and JWT authentication.
keyFeatures: Real-time progress tracking with visual indicators
Flexible tagging and categorization system
Reading streak and habit analytics
Data export functionality for personal records
solution.architecture: Clean architecture with repository pattern, JWT authentication, and containerized deployment

title: College Management Microservices
fullDescription: Microservices architecture replicating UNAM's college management system. Includes student enrollment, course management, grading, notifications, and inter-service communication with event-driven patterns.

problemStatement.problemDescription: Traditional university management systems are monolithic, difficult to scale, and suffer from single points of failure during enrollment periods.
problemList: System crashes during peak enrollment periods
Slow performance with increasing student numbers
Difficult to implement new features or updates
Lack of real-time notifications and updates

solution.title: Domain-Driven Microservices Architecture
solution.description: Designed a domain-driven microservices architecture with bounded contexts for each university domain.
keyFeatures: Independent service scaling during enrollment peaks
Event-driven communication for real-time updates
Comprehensive monitoring with Prometheus/Grafana
Container orchestration for high availability
solution.architecture: Domain-driven design with bounded contexts, CQRS, and event sourcing patterns

title: Cooking Recipe Platform
fullDescription: Complete web application for sharing and discovering recipes. Angular frontend with Python FastAPI backend featuring user authentication, recipe CRUD operations, search, filtering, and social features.

problemStatement.problemDescription: Home cooks struggle with scattered recipes across websites, books, and notes, making meal planning and cooking inefficient.
problemList: Recipes scattered across multiple platforms
No unified search and filtering system
Difficulty in meal planning and grocery list generation
Lack of nutritional information and dietary filtering

solution.title: Modern Full-Stack Web Application
solution.description: Built a responsive Angular frontend with FastAPI backend for a seamless recipe management experience.
keyFeatures: Advanced search with ingredient-based filtering
Interactive cooking mode with step timers
Grocery list generation from selected recipes
Nutritional calculator and dietary restriction filters
solution.architecture: Client-server architecture with JWT authentication, PostgreSQL for data persistence, and containerized deployment

title: Video Courses Platform
fullDescription: Scalable video course platform with microservices architecture. Includes course management, user enrollment, video streaming, payment processing, and notification systems with Go Fiber framework.

problemStatement.problemDescription: Existing e-learning platforms struggle with video streaming performance, course management scalability, and integrated payment systems.
problemList: Poor video streaming quality and buffering issues
Limited scalability during course launch events
Fragmented payment and certificate systems
Lack of real-time progress tracking for students

solution.title: Go-Based Microservices Platform
solution.description: Implemented a high-performance microservices architecture using Go Fiber for handling concurrent video streaming requests.
keyFeatures: Adaptive bitrate streaming with HLS protocol
Real-time progress syncing across devices
Integrated payment processing with Stripe
Automated certificate generation upon course completion
solution.architecture: Microservices with API Gateway pattern, S3 for video storage, Redis for caching, and Kubernetes for orchestration

title: Cinema Management System
fullDescription: Complete cinema management system with microservices for movie catalog, showtime scheduling, ticket booking, payment processing, and notification services using Python FastAPI.

problemStatement.problemDescription: Traditional cinema systems have poor real-time seat management, limited payment options, and no personalized customer experience.
problemList: Double booking due to poor seat synchronization
Limited payment gateway integrations
No personalized recommendations or notifications
Manual reporting and analytics processes

solution.title: Real-Time Microservices Ticketing Platform
solution.description: Built a distributed system with real-time seat locking, multiple payment gateways, and AI-powered recommendations.
keyFeatures: WebSocket-based real-time seat reservation
Multi-provider payment gateway integration
Personalized movie recommendations engine
Automated reporting and analytics dashboard
solution.architecture: Event-driven microservices with WebSocket for real-time updates, Redis for caching, and message queue for notifications

title: Cinema Frontend
fullDescription: Responsive Angular application for cinema ticket booking with real-time seat selection, movie browsing, showtime checking, and booking management using Angular Material and Tailwind CSS.

problemStatement.problemDescription: Existing cinema booking interfaces are cluttered, slow, and not optimized for mobile devices, leading to abandoned bookings.
problemList: Complex and confusing seat selection interface
Slow page loads and poor performance scores
Not responsive across different device sizes
Lack of engaging content like trailers and reviews

solution.title: Modern Angular PWA with Real-Time Features
solution.description: Developed a Progressive Web App with real-time seat updates, engaging content, and mobile-first design.
keyFeatures: Interactive SVG-based seat selection with visual feedback
Progressive Web App capabilities for offline functionality
Optimized performance with lazy loading and code splitting
Rich media integration with trailers and user reviews
solution.architecture: Component-based Angular architecture with RxJS for state management, PWA capabilities, and optimized bundle delivery
